Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to believe
Hedge Example: I think it's an important issue.
Non-hedge Example: I thought of the solution.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to think; to hold as an opinion
Hedge Example: I believe I met him at last year's picnic
Non-hedge Definition: to accept as true; to believe in something/someone
Non-hedge Example: I believe you.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to regard as; to think/believe
Hedge Example: I consider the failure to be intentional
Non-hedge Definition: to reflect on; to pay attention to
Non-hedge Example: We can consider the case based on this cause of action.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to take without evidence
Hedge Example: I assumed this position was temporary.
Non-hedge Definition: to take on; to take over; to take upon oneself
Non-hedge Example: I assumed this position upon his retirement.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to perceive; to hold a point of view
Hedge Example: I understand it to the in the range of $30-40 million.
Non-hedge Example: I understand what you are saying.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to perceive
Hedge Example: I found it curious that you were objective to it.
Non-hedge Example: I found my keys under the couch.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to think
Hedge Example: I felt it was uncalled for.
Non-hedge Example: I felt sick afterwards.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: not sure
Hedge Example: I don't know if that's a good idea.
Non-hedge Example: I don't know her phone number.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to give the impression of being
Hedge Example: The problem appears to be a bug in the software.
Non-hedge Definition: to come into sight; to be part of a stage performance
Non-hedge Example: A bird I didn't recognize appeared in our yard on Sunday.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to give the impression of being
Hedge Example: The problem seems to be a bug in the software.
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to give the impression of being
Hedge Example: The problem looks like a bug in the software.
Non-hedge Example: He looks like Ryan Gosling.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to assume; to take without evidence
Hedge Example: I suppose the package will arrive next week.
Non-hedge Example: I'm supposed to call if I'm going to be late.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to give the impression of being
Hedge Example: He is seemingly recovered from his extended illness.
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to form a theory or conjecture
Hedge Example: I guess they’re not coming.
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to form an opinion of; to provide a rough approximation
Hedge Example: He estimated their number to be in the thousands.
Non-hedge Definition: a statement of approximate charge for work being done
Non-hedge Example: The contractor submitted the estimate on Monday.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to form a theory or conjecture
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: to cause one to think that something is the case; to put forward for consideration
Hedge Example: The results suggest that the procedure is effective.
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses possibility
Hedge Example: That may be an effect of bioterrorism.
Non-hedge Example: The action may be brought at any time within two years.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses possibility
Hedge Example: You could be right.
Non-hedge Example: I could touch my toes easily when I was younger.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses likeliness
Hedge Example: It should be rainy tomorrow.
Non-hedge Example: A good system should be able to handle any airport.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses possibility
Hedge Example: It might be a problem with the server.
Non-hedge Example: You might just give a very short explanation of what it is.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses uncertainty
Hedge Example: That is not necessarily the case.
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses uncertainty
Hedge Example: He surely must have knowledge of this.
Non-hedge Definition: in a sure and confident manner
Non-hedge Example: He stepped surely across the chasm.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses uncertainty
Hedge Example: Jane was probably drunk.
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses uncertainty
Non-hedge Example: He is a likely mate.

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses uncertainty
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses uncertainty
Non-hedge Example: NA

Definition of Hedge Type: Creates uncertainty in the commitment of the speaker to what they are saying.
Hedge Definition: expresses uncertainty
Hedge Example: I'm unsure about this.
Non-hedge Example: The footing on the bridge was unsure.

Definition of Hedge Type: Attributive hedge - the speaker attributes information to some other source in order to downplay its force or to garner authoritative power for  their statement rather than committing to the proposition themselves.
Hedge Example: I read that this place is bad.
Non-hedge Definition: to look at carefully in order to understand the meaning
Non-hedge Example: I read a book.

Definition of Hedge Type: Attributive hedge - the speaker attributes information to some other source in order to downplay its force or to garner authoritative power for  their statement rather than committing to the proposition themselves.
Hedge Definition: They say it's impossible to get a job there.

Definition of Hedge Type: hProp
Hedge Example: almost, approximately, near, on the verge of
Non-hedge Definition: regarding, near (as in 'he has a funny air about him'), other

Hedge Definition: So basically you add up your R squareds and whatever's left is unexplained variability.

Definition of Hedge Type: Introduces uncertainty into the content of the utterance itself; can insert 'I'm certain (that) …' before the sentence and it doesn't change the meaning.
Hedge Definition: It is largely known that this university has a good reputation and an excellent track record.

Definition of Hedge Type: Introduces uncertainty into the content of the utterance itself; can insert 'I'm certain (that) …' before the sentence and it doesn't change the meaning.
Hedge Definition: It's kind of hard to read them straight up and down like that.; In this example, the author indicates that there is some difficulty in accomplishing the task of reading, but it is the degree of difficulty rather than its existence that is in question - so here, 'kind of' introduces fuzziness into degree/quantity of an action.

Definition of Hedge Type: Introduces uncertainty into the content of the utterance itself; can insert 'I'm certain (that) …' before the sentence and it doesn't change the meaning.
Hedge Definition: His feet are sort of blue; marks non-prototypicality with respect to a regular shade of blue.

Definition of Hedge Type: Introduces uncertainty into the content of the utterance itself; can insert 'I'm certain (that) …' before the sentence and it doesn't change the meaning.
Hedge Definition: Sometimes, it's difficult; here 'sometimes' introduces fuzziness into the quantity of difficulty.
if the speaker is uncertain or appears to be deliberately underspecifying
Hedge Example: Well somebody already answered those questions um I won't say who.
Non-hedge Definition: when used as a grammatical necessity or when specification would not be necessary in the context of the conversation
Non-hedge Example: It would be so easy for somebody to disturb something here.

Hedge Definition: And I saw somebody who shouldn't have been there walking down the hall.
The decline of profits due to the negative reviews of the product is possible.
Hedge Example: something that may or may not be true vs something that has the ability to occur

Hedge Definition: It's a case of assault and probable theft.
in fact, really
Hedge Example: used to suggest something unexpected ; eg."he could actually read the Greek"

Hedge Definition: similar to, approximately; when used as a discourse filler word; et cetera (eg. 'and the like')
Hedge Example: to feel attraction toward, to enjoy, to want, to approve of; such as; as if
